reviewText: Was thrilled to see this movie available on DVD...One of Richard Gere's first and under rated films....  A classic ...John Presutti

reviewText: One of my all time favourites...a very well acted drama with a great cast fronted by a very young and handsome Richard Gere. Has some wonderful moments of acting particularly from Paul Sorvino....I suppose it is a bit of a man's movie as opposed to a chick flick but it can be enjoyed by everyone. Highly recommended !
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had totally forgotten about this film until recently and purchased it and really enjoyed it.  Gere is great in this role and it's nice to see Marilu Henner in a small supporting role.  I really enjoyed the relationship between Gere's role and his younger brother, and only wish there were more scenes of this.  Also, look for a pre Freddy Kruger Robert Englund in this film  Good relationship,character study and good acting by all.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 1975, Richard Gere, Paul Sorvino, Tony LoBianco. Should be good...right? Very wrong. Even in 1975 stereotypes shouldn't be this outrageous. Loud and boisterous are Tony and Paul. this is the story of an Italian family struggling to survive in 1975 (????) there was a struggle???? Anyway, Richard Gere loves his little brother, Richard is a young 18 maybe and the little brother is maybe 6 or 7. Here it comes...little brother is thin...OH MY GOD! the mother played by Lelia Goldoni, is a nightmare in every possible way...overacts and her character is literally a moron...screeching about killing herself because her son is thin?????!!!!!! What in God's name caused this movie and what in God's name made me buy it???
Title: N/A
